action_output_list: The user wants to create an event in Simple Calendar Pro. I need to open the app first.{"action_type": "open_app", "app_name": "Simple Calendar Pro"}
The user wants to create a new event. The current screen shows the calendar view. To create a new event, I should click on the "New Event" button.{"action_type": "click", "index": 69}

The user wants to create a new event with the name 'Meeting'. The current screen is the event creation screen. I should input the event name into the title field.{"action_type": "input_text", "text": "Meeting", "index": 8}
The next step is to set the location of the event. I will click on the location field (index 9) to enter the location.{"action_type": "click", "index": 9}

The user wants to set the location of the event to 'Conference Room'. The current screen shows a text field for location input. I should input the location 'Conference Room' into the text field (index 8).{"action_type": "input_text", "text": "Conference Room", "index": 8}
The location "Conference Room" is suggested, so I should click on it to select it.{"action_type": "click", "index": 10}
The user wants to set the description for the event. The next step is to click on the description field (index 11) to input the description.{"action_type": "click", "index": 11}

The previous action resulted in navigating to the settings page instead of the event creation page. I need to go back to the event creation page to continue filling in the event details.{"action_type": "navigate_back"}

The previous action resulted in navigating back to the calendar view. The goal is to create a new event, so I need to click on the "New Event" button again to start the event creation process.{"action_type": "click", "index": 69}

The previous action resulted in the location being set. Now, the next step is to input the description for the event. The description field is not visible, so I need to scroll down to find it.{"action_type": "scroll", "direction": "down"}
